pr_title: Add BFM support in new parser

timeline.message: Add first stage parsing for ballerina flavored markdown
Revamp first stage parsing for ballerina flavored markdown
Modify syntax tree to support BFM
Add second stage parsing for BFM
Modify syntax tree to support code references in BFM
Add code reference support in BFM
Refactor code and add few test cases
Change BFM parsing and update test cases accordingly
Change node transformer logic for documentationStringNode and fix lexer bug
Improve inline double and triple backtick documentation support and add test cases
Extend node transformer logic to support all kind of documentation lines

Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/ballerina-platform/ballerina-lang into doc-support

shall we replace the for-loop inside stringToRefType with a switch case?

timeline.bodyText:
Is it possible to merge this section with the lookAheadForDocumentationReference method?
i.e:  lookAheadForDocumentationReference will process all the tokens and returns the token, instead of the lookahead count
timeline.author: SupunS

timeline.bodyText: Can we handle this without throwing an exception?
timeline.author: SupunS

timeline.bodyText: what if we send a 'return' keyword token from the lexer?

timeline.bodyText:
Can you explain whats happening in tis snippet?
I think you'l have to consider windows environments as well, since in windows, theres a carriage return (\r) for newlines.
timeline.author: SupunS

replies.bodyText:
To get the full text containing in the NodeList<Node> docElements. I loop through it and append all docElement.toString()s. In the last docElement there will be a \n in its last children's trailing minutiae which should not be included in the documentation line text.
yeah few parser tests too are falling in windows build. That's should be due  to above reason. I'll fix
replies.author: lochana-chathura

replies.bodyText: I think the issue is using element.toString(). That can cause issues  since toString() includes minutiae such as newlines, invalid tokens etc. We should use .text() method in the Token class
replies.author: SupunS

replies.bodyText: We will have a problem for lines having documentation reference. e.g  text of annotation `field a` documentation will be annotation`field a`documentation   if we use .text(), as white spaces there are captured as trivia. Shall I use toString() anyway? and replace \r\n and  \n with "" at the end
replies.author: lochana-chathura

replies.bodyText:
ah ok. +1.
But please make sure it won't include other minutiae such as invalid nodes, comments, etc.
replies.author: SupunS

timeline.bodyText:
Shall we use the constant LexerTerminals.RETURN.
BTW, usually we swap the arguments as a practice to make the .equals() is called on the constant..
eg: "return".equals(getLexeme()) or LexerTerminals.RETURN.equals(getLexeme())
That way we can avoid any possible NPE.  i.e: even if getLexeme() returns a null, it will not throw a NPE
timeline.author: SupunS

timeline.message: Fix end of line test cases failing for windows environment
